creator: gregor@apache.org
text:
we currently have our own root sitemap (and global-sitemap.xmap) that frequently
gets out of sync with the cocoon sitemap. it would be better to only keep the
lenya specific parts and use xpatch to generate the final sitemap. this would
also make it easier to move lenya to a block architecture

this might help for the whole lenya build:

http://wiki.cocoondev.org/Wiki.jsp?page=YourCocoonBasedProjectAnt16
creator: gregor@apache.org
gregor@apache.org
text:
the lenya root sitemap is now assembled with xpatch. what needs to be done is to
convert the existing xslt under WEB-INF to xpatch format.

creator: gregor@apache.org
text:
this is now done for web.xml and logkit.xconf. cocoon.xconf needs some more work
as the xslt that processes it is more complex.

creator: andreas@apache.org
text: Usecases are now configured via Xpatch.
